διεγ-είρω,
wake up, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; stir up, arouse, [LXX]; excite, promote, αὔξησιν φυτοῦ [Refs]:—passive, [LXX+5th c.BC+]; to be raised up from a sick-bed, [Refs 1st c.AD+]aorist διέγρετο[Refs]
__II raise, τὸν αὐχένα [Refs 1st c.AD+]:—passive, πύλας διεγειρομένας εἰς ὕψος πηχῶν ἑβδομήκοντα [LXX+5th c.AD+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
to get up, arouse, stimulate
to arouse, or awake thoroughly,get up Mt. 1:24; Mk. 4:38, 39; Lk. 8:24; passive to be raised, excited, agitated, as a sea, Jn. 6:18; metaphorically to stir up, arouse, animate, 2Pet. 1:13; 3:1
